question_text: Universal public healthcare should be guaranteed to everyone.
Large corporations should be broken up when they gain outsized market power.
Publicly funded college or vocational training is worth higher taxes.
Workers should have stronger legal protections to unionize and strike.
Basic utilities (water, electricity, internet) should be treated as public services.
The wealthy should pay significantly higher marginal tax rates than they do now.
Rent control or similar measures are needed to keep housing affordable.
Government stimulus is appropriate to reduce unemployment during downturns.
A universal basic income would improve economic security.
Trade policy should prioritize worker protections over lower consumer prices.
Private enterprise is generally more efficient than government at delivering services.
Lower taxes on businesses ultimately benefit everyone through growth.
Welfare programs often create harmful dependency.
Environmental regulation should not slow economic development.
Privatizing more public services would improve quality and reduce costs.
Minimum wage laws should be limited to avoid pricing people out of jobs.
Free trade without tariffs is the best path to prosperity.
Capital gains should be taxed less than ordinary income to incentivize investment.
Pension and entitlement programs need significant cuts to remain sustainable.
Housing should be left mostly to market forces rather than public intervention.
People should be free to live as they wish so long as they do not harm others.
Civil liberties should not be curtailed even during times of crisis.
Drug use should be treated primarily as a health issue, not a crime.
Censorship by the state is more dangerous than offensive speech.
Surveillance powers should be strictly limited to protect privacy.
Immigration enriches society and should be made easier for most applicants.
Adult consensual relationships and identities are a personal matter for the individual.
Criminal justice should emphasize rehabilitation over punishment.
Religious beliefs should not determine public policy.
The press should be free to criticize the government without restriction.
Maintaining public order sometimes requires sacrificing certain freedoms.
Harsh penalties are necessary to deter crime effectively.
Authorities should have broad powers to monitor communications for security.
Traditional family structures deserve preference in law and policy.
Schools should teach respect for national symbols and rituals.
Obscenity and hate speech should be restricted to protect social harmony.
Immigration should be tightly controlled to protect cultural cohesion.
Military strength and tough policing are the foundation of a safe society.
Religious values should guide public morality and legislation.
Civic duties like compulsory national service would build stronger citizens.
